simulated_ratings.title: Rocky Horror Picture Show, The (1975)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Campy fun, but the musical excess and anything-goes chaos wear me out.

simulated_ratings.title: Hurlyburly (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Talky Hollywood angst leaves me cool—sharp bits, too meandering overall.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Shameless (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blunt, honest and funny in stretches, but the crude sheen wears thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic absurd bits I love, even if the sketch format is hit-and-miss.

simulated_ratings.title: Yellow Submarine (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive visuals, but the psychedelic whimsy wears thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Detroit Rock City (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rowdy fanboy hijinks feel more shrill than clever.

simulated_ratings.title: Tommy (1975)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bold rock-opera spectacle, but the melodrama outweighs the payoff for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Antonia's Line (Antonia) (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, humane tapestry with quirky charm, just a bit sedate.

simulated_ratings.title: History of the World: Part I (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mel Brooks’ irreverence hits more than it misses—very much my lane.

simulated_ratings.title: I'm Gonna Git You Sucka (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Enjoyably goofy genre send-up, uneven but good-natured.

simulated_ratings.title: Return of the Pink Panther, The (1975)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sellers’ bumbling charm works, though the slapstick can overstay.

simulated_ratings.title: Man with Two Brains, The (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sublimely dumb concept, hit-or-miss execution.

simulated_ratings.title: George Carlin: Life Is Worth Losing (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dark, incisive social rants—acerbic in a way I dig.

simulated_ratings.title: Young Frankenstein (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pitch-perfect parody—my favorite kind of smart, silly comedy.

simulated_ratings.title: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex * But Were Afraid to Ask (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever vignettes with clear highs and lows—interesting more than essential.

simulated_ratings.title: Caddyshack (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loose, quotable fun, but the scattershot tone keeps it at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some laughs, more repetition—less spark than the earlier outing.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Chewed Up (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tart, truthful and crude—funny, if not all gold.

simulated_ratings.title: Fish Called Wanda, A (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, character-driven caper with the kind of wit I appreciate.

simulated_ratings.title: Bananas (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy political farce with flashes of inspired silliness.

simulated_ratings.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet road-trip antics with heart, if a bit broad.

simulated_ratings.title: Larry David: Curb Your Enthusiasm (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dry cringe with good laughs, though uneven as a one-off.

simulated_ratings.title: Funny Bones (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Showbiz melancholy intrigues, but the mix doesn’t fully gel for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Kung Fury (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Retro spoof energy is cute in short bursts, thin beyond that.

simulated_ratings.title: Birdcage, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bright, fast farce with sharp performances—my kind of polished comedy.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Hilarious (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Aging-curmudgeon observations land well—consistently funny.

simulated_ratings.title: So I Married an Axe Murderer (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky charm and offbeat bits, but it wobbles.

simulated_ratings.title: Real Genius (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever teen-geek antics

simulated_ratings.title: Rent (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest and big-hearted, but the rock-opera melodrama isn’t my tempo.

simulated_ratings.title: Clue (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snappy ensemble whodunit—fast talk and farce done right.

Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear, The (1991)

simulated_ratings.title: Dogma (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Talky, irreverent religious satire hits more than it misses—funny, a bit baggy.

simulated_ratings.title: Ordinary People (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, well-drawn grief drama—affecting if a touch sedate for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Bowfinger (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Showbiz farce with a clever hook and steady laughs—breezy and satisfying.

simulated_ratings.title: Pootie Tang (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Go-for-broke absurdity lands a few laughs, but feels thin and one-note.

simulated_ratings.title: Everything Will Be OK (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, witty existential doodle that sneaks up on me—oddly moving.

simulated_ratings.title: Angels and Insects (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lush period intrigue with a dark undercurrent—engaging, if measured.

simulated_ratings.title: Lolita (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Provocative and uneasy by design

simulated_ratings.title: Clerks (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Deadpan, foul-mouthed slacker riffs—my kind of sharp, low-budget comedy.

simulated_ratings.title: Zebra Lounge (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slicker-than-substance erotic-thriller nonsense—more eye-rolls than thrills.

simulated_ratings.title: Working Girl (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snappy, crowd-pleasing office romance with enough spark to win me over.

simulated_ratings.title: Desperately Seeking Susan (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky mistaken-identity romp—fun in spots, a little scattershot.

simulated_ratings.title: Tin Men (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Character-driven feud comedy that amuses more than it dazzles.

simulated_ratings.title: Silence of the Sea, The (Le silence de la mer) (1949)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quiet resistance and restraint—admirable, muted, and a bit austere.

simulated_ratings.title: Copycat (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Competent, tense serial-killer procedural with a few smart jolts.

simulated_ratings.title: The Rolling Stones: Ladies & Gentlemen, the Rolling Stones (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid set and energy, but concert docs aren’t really my lane.

simulated_ratings.title: Mount St. Elias (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Impressive vistas and nerve-testing feats—compelling enough in documentary mode.

simulated_ratings.title: eXistenZ (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Twisty, tactile sci‑fi mind game—odd and engaging in a way I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Crooklyn (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, lived-in family portrait—charming, if a shade gentle for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Manhattan (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wry and romantic, but the age-gap thread keeps me at a distance.

simulated_ratings.title: Tales from the Crypt Presents: Bordello of Blood (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cheeky, blood-slick camp that wears out its welcome fast.

simulated_ratings.title: From Dusk Till Dawn (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pulpy two-hander turned creature-feature—rowdy fun, if uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Beck 48  - Quid Pro Quo (2023)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Routine casework with a few turns—watchable, not memorable.

simulated_ratings.title: Get Shorty (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cool, witty crime-meets-Hollywood caper—smart, slick, and enjoyable.

recommended_movies: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)
I Am Big Bird: The Caroll Spinney Story (2014)

simulated_ratings.title: Jackass 3D (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A few guilty giggles, but the gross-out stunt reel wears me out fast.

simulated_ratings.title: BASEketball (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy sports spoof with a few laughs, too juvenile and thin for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sumptuous, nasty morality play - I admire the style even as it keeps me at a chilly remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick, kinetic revenge pulp - fun in bursts, but the blood-soaked style outweighs the substance for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Story of Us, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest marital angst with some bits, but the schmaltz and bickering wear thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Jackass Number Two (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: More of the same gleeful abuse - sporadically funny, mostly tiresome.

simulated_ratings.title: War of the Roses, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acerbic, escalating marital warfare - mean-spirited in a way I mostly enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Safe (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Chilly, unsettling malaise - admirable craft, purposefully muted to a fault for me.

simulated_ratings.title: One Cut of the Dead (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, low-budget meta-farce that builds beautifully - right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2 (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: More character and wit to balance the carnage - engaging, if still indulgent.

simulated_ratings.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hypnotic, chilly psychosexual maze - intriguing more than enveloping for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Newsies (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Energetic and earnest, but musical theatrics leave me at arm's length.

simulated_ratings.title: Greener Grass (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Affectless suburban absurdity with some sharp laughs, but the one-note shtick wears thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Dancer in the Dark (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bold and wrenching, but the grim musical melodrama isn't my tempo.

simulated_ratings.title: Beavis and Butt-Head Do America (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some dumb-fun gags land, but the doofus road trip runs out of wit.

simulated_ratings.title: 6 Points About Emma (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intimate character study with a thorny lead - engaging in parts, a bit schematic for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Bean (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some inspired physical gags, but the stretched-out slapstick wears me down.

simulated_ratings.title: Swept Away (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tone-deaf romance-and-class farce - awkward and airless.

simulated_ratings.title: Powder (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest fable with a heavy hand - more hokum than wonder for me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Bandit Hound (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cutesy, low-stakes caper

simulated_ratings.title: Stars and Stripes Forever (1952)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stately musical bio with rousing marches - polite, not really my lane.

simulated_ratings.title: Ladies Man, The (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: SNL sketch thinness stretched past breaking - few laughs, mostly groans.

simulated_ratings.title: Dave Attell: Road Work (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quick, dirty and punchy - solid laughs, even if the raunch blurs together.

simulated_ratings.title: Zed & Two Noughts, A (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Meticulous, morbid whimsy - visually arresting, emotionally distant for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Invincible Shaolin (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Crisp choreography and training beats, but the rote vendetta plot keeps me at a remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Hardly a Butterfly (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Low-key, small-town character piece with gentle charms - pleasant, not memorable.

simulated_ratings.title: Conan the Barbarian (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mythic, musclebound pulp with some charm - watchable, but not my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Pokémon: The First Movie (1998)

simulated_ratings.title: Pumpkin (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Awkward satirical romance—good intentions, wobbly tone.

simulated_ratings.title: Gods Must Be Crazy II, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, contrived sequel gags—sporadic chuckles, mostly thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Crossroads (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bluesy myth-making with moments, but the journey feels schematic.

simulated_ratings.title: Johnny Got His Gun (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, effective anti-war chamber piece—powerful, if punishing.

simulated_ratings.title: Deathtrap (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Twisty, stagey murder farce—sharp fun right in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Little Shop of Horrors (1986)

simulated_ratings.title: Death Becomes Her (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy, acidic camp with fun ideas—amusing more than engrossing.

simulated_ratings.title: George Carlin: Jammin' in New York (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Razor-edged social rants—Carlin in peak, crackling form.

simulated_ratings.title: Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snappy, witty mini-musical—light on its feet and cleverly bittersweet.

simulated_ratings.title: Muppet Treasure Island (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cheery, tuneful romp—pleasant, but the family-musical tone isn’t my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Muriel's Wedding (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bittersweet misfit comedy with heart—engaging, if a touch broad.

simulated_ratings.title: Farinelli: il castrato (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lush period music drama I respect more than I connect with.

simulated_ratings.title: Happy Cleaners (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, small-scale family struggles—gently affecting, if modest.

simulated_ratings.title: Sicko (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pointed, persuasive agitprop—compelling, even if heavy-handed.

simulated_ratings.title: Joy Division (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Informative music-scene chronicle—interesting, but music docs aren’t my lane.

simulated_ratings.title: Deconstructing Harry (1997)

simulated_ratings.title: Henry (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleazy musician caper beats—amusing in spots, slight overall.

simulated_ratings.title: Berserk: The Golden Age Arc 3 - Descent (2013)

simulated_ratings.title: Fatso (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Kind, food-loving dramedy—warmth and melancholy in an agreeable mix.

simulated_ratings.title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit? (1988)

simulated_ratings.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux (1993)

simulated_ratings.title: Goldstone (2016)

simulated_ratings.title: Stargate SG-1 Children of the Gods - Final Cut (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: Diese Nacht vergess ich nie (1949)

simulated_ratings.title: Candyman (1992)
